reviewsJson.markdown:
**Setup** Troll v2, Dual 26/32 N80 Clapton 7 wrap 3mm id, 50 watts, full wicks

**Testing** DIYFS Chocolate Cookie Rounds 5% 70%VG steep 6 days

**Flavor Description** A buttery chocolate chip flavor with a bit of cookie grainy feel to it. Reminds me of the same cocoa taste that is in their nutella flavor. It’s a decent chocolate taste, not really like an oreo reminds me more of a chips ahoy chocolate chip. Its slightly more creamy than cookie and at higher wattage is gross, like a super burnt cookie crust. 

*Muted chocolate butter flavor.*

**Off-flavors**:  Not really an oreo cookie flavor, a bit more buttery than expected. 

**Throat Hit**:  something but not much (3/10)

**Uses**:  Not really sure. I think this could somehow work for a chocolate chip cookie recipe. Its just a weak flavoring and its quite dark so anything over 5% will result in a considerably brown final product. I think paired with some other stronger chocolate (HS Australian chocolate) and maybe more cookie flavor, this could make a nice crumble for ice cream cake ( which Is what I first thought of when I saw this flavor). Not sure I will use this flavor in the future but it is ok at best.

**Pairings**:  Creams, custards, other chocolates, butter, cakes, cookies, ice cream. 

**Notes** I’d say skip this one, chocolate gunks your coils anyway.

**Second Opinions**

Nothing out there, probably for good reason.
reviewsJson.author: HashSlingingSlashur
reviewsJson.title: Chocolate Cookie Rounds
